title: How to Cook Popcorn in a Pan

steps.title: Pour enough oil to lightly coat the bottom of the pot.
steps.content: Pour enough oil to lightly coat the bottom of the pot. Turn on the burner to medium high.

steps.title: Place one or two kernels of popcorn into the pot, then place the pot onto the burner.
steps.content: Place one or two kernels of popcorn into the pot, then place the pot onto the burner. Place the lid onto the pot.

steps.title: Wait until you can hear the popcorn pop.
steps.content: Wait until you can hear the popcorn pop. This depends on the heat and size of the pan, but is usually between 1 and 5 minutes.

steps.title: Make a light layer of popcorn on the bottom of the pan, not more than one kernel deep, once the popcorn has popped.
steps.content: Make a light layer of popcorn on the bottom of the pan, not more than one kernel deep, once the popcorn has popped.

steps.title: Replace the lid and let the kernels you've added pop.
steps.content: Replace the lid and let the kernels you've added pop.

steps.title: Listen for the slowing down of popping, being careful not to burn the popcorn.
steps.content: Listen for the slowing down of popping, being careful not to burn the popcorn.

steps.title: Remove the pan from the burner once the popcorn has popped.
steps.content: Remove the pan from the burner once the popcorn has popped. Turn off the oven. Pour the popcorn into a bowl, season to your liking, and serve.
